column11: Any general comments or suggestions about the course?

I think the practical section of the course would greatly improve if it included a live walkthrough of the exercise. It's easier to follow a teacher performing an exercise and then repeating it instead of just tackling it by following written instructions.

I feel like I learned a lot in the short time frame of the course. Of course I don't feel expert in this domain yet and I would probably need to work more on it to feel comfortable at actually using a SDM in a project, but I do feel capable to learn these topics more in depth and I feel like this is really attainable. Maybe going over a full scientific article that uses SDM correctly could be interesting to better visualize the methods that are used in practice and how to interpret the results.

a short but guided live exercise would be really useful in each of the key steps of SDMs... as we did for example on data cleaning. I would say one in variable selection, background points and extent, algorithm selection, and evaluation would be really good as a general approach. Also valid to say that the approach to a flexible use of time is really good! Overall I found the course really useful. Thanks!
